CatDescriptText: O.D. Hawkins, retired railroad worker, North Side was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "From what I read, I don't think so, but I'm hoping that a Negro will be appointed..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of O.D. Hawkins wearing fedora and patterned bow tie, standing in front of C.A. Michel Company, Smithfield Street, Downtown
